title: Popular Night Tours of Seoul's Historic Quarter to Resume This Week
text:
A nighttime tour program to explore the historic quarter near Deoksu Palace in downtown Seoul will be revived after being suspended just last year.

The Seoul city government on Monday said the walking tour will take place on Friday and Saturday.

The program, which the Jung District Office launched in 2015, had been very popular among both Koreans and foreign visitors as it offered an opportunity to appreciate the city's historic sites during the early modern period of Korea twice a year, in May and October.

But it was abruptly suspended in July last year when a new chief took over at the Jung District Office. This led some 20 cultural, religious and educational organizations of the district to work together with the city government to revive the tour.

A royal marching band will kick the revived tour off with a parade around Deoksu Palace at 6:30 p.m. on Friday. As before, the event will offer a variety of hands-on activities, performances and guided tours.

From next year the program will take place once a year in spring.

"It will be held every May starting next year," a city government official said. "We'll make the program a major festival of the city, giving citizens a chance to learn about the significance and history of the area."
